spell.name: Amanuensis
entries: You point at the writing and then move your hand as though holding a stylus or quill. As you intone the spell, the script appears on a sheet of paper close at hand.

You cause writing from one source (such as a book) to be copied into a book, paper, or parchment. This spell copies 250 words per minute (about one page) and creates a perfect duplicate of the original. The spell copies only nonmagical text, not illustrations or magical writings (such as the text of a spellbook or a spell scroll). If the target contains normal and magical writing (such as a letter with a glyph of warding), only the normal text is copied, leaving blank space in the copied text where the magical writing would be expected. Likewise, if the target contains text and illustration, only the text is copied.
The spell triggers (but does not copy) writing-based magic traps in the material being copied.

Blank paper, parchment, or a book must be provided for the spell to write upon. If the target has multiple pages, the spell automatically turns to the next blank page whenever necessary. If more pages in the target exist than blank pages are available, the spell copies the original until it runs out of blank pages. At any time during the spell's duration you can redirect the magic to copy from another target, copy onto a different blank source, or resume a duplication that was interrupted by a shortfall of blank pages.
The spell does not translate the copied writing. If you do not understand the original, you have no additional ability to understand the copy.

spell.name: Defensestration
entries: When you cast this spell, all nonmagical glass and ceramic within 30 feet shatters. Creatures made of glass or ceramic must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 1d12} thunder damage on a failed save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d12}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d12}).

spell.name: Ferment
entries: With this spell, you render one vessel of liquid (no larger than 1 gallon) mildly alcoholic (about 3% ABV). This is enough to kill common microbial contaminants, but has no effect on poison or disease. This spell is alternately loved and derided, and the quality of the beverage produced depends greatly on the base liquid being transmuted. Remember, just because you can, doesn't mean you should.

components.m: A pinch of yeast

spell.name: Iron Scarf
entries: The cloth of a scarf or similarly sized article of clothing you are holding is transmuted to be as hard and sharp as steel. For the duration, you can make a melee weapon attack with the scarf, which deals {@damage 1d6} slashing damage and has the finesse and light properties.  You may add your spellcasting ability modifier to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, and you are proficient with attacks made with this weapon.  The weapon is treated as magical. The spell ends if you cast it again or if you let go of the scarf. When the spell ends the scarf resumes its normal form.

components.m: a scarf or long piece of cloth and a handful of iron filings.

spell.name: Scholar's Touch
entries: With this spell you can touch a book or scroll and absorb the knowledge contained within as if you had just read it. A single casting of this spell can parse roughly 100 pages of text.

This is equivalent to a solid reading but not deep studyâ€” you do not gain perfect recall of the information, just whatever you would have gotten from reading it completely once. If you can't read the language of the source, the spell has no effect.

This spell cannot be used to prepare spells or to cast magical scrolls, nor does it have any effect when reading a magical book (such as a tome of understanding). However, you do not have to be able to see to cast this spell, making it useful for mages suffering from prolonged visual impairment or with failing eyesight from advanced age.

components.m: A scrap of parchment and a lump of charcoal.

spell.name: Stone Fist
entries: You transmute one of your hands into living stone and strike an enemy with it. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d12} bludgeoning damage. This does not count as magical for the purposes of overcoming damage resistances or immunities.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d12} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d12}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d12}).

components.m: A pebble, held in hand.

spell.name: Transmute Bread to Noodles
entries: When you cast this spell you touch a quantity of bread. The bread is magically changed to an equal volume of unseasoned, room-temperature, cooked noodles.
No magic short of a {@spell wish} spell can reverse this change.

spell.name: Break
entries: Accidentally developed by an apprentice trying to master the mending cantrip, this unfortunate mistake occurred when trying to mend a tear in her noble patron's ball gown at a court function, leaving the patron in her undergarments and ensuring a swift trip to the dungeon for the apprentice.

This spell damages an object you touch, easily breaking chain links, sundering keys, unravelling cloaks, or perforating wineskins. In fact, it is a bit violent for most of these applications, causing many softer materials to explode in a puff of dust. This spell cannot cause damage to magical items, but it can affect creatures of the Construct type, most of which have nonmagical components that interact with their enchanted parts.
Make a melee spell attack against a Construct or nonmagical object you can reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d12} force damage.

components.m: three lodestones

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 1st. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can use it to dissolve {@item sovereign glue}.

spell.name: Condense Time
entries: When you cast this spell, the target of the spell is shifted into a condensed timeline, making them appear to move in slow motion relative to the caster's frame of reference. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration.
An affected target's speed is halved. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both.
A creature affected by this spell that is making Death Saving throws needs to only make one every other turn.
A creature affected by this spell makes another Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the effect ends for it.

spell.name: Disjoint
entries: When you cast this spell one of your extremities separates from your body and moves under your control. A {@creature Crawling Claw} appears in an unoccupied space adjacent to your own. You control this creature for the duration while it remains within range. You can reattached the extremity to your body as a bonus action at any point while it is adjacent to you. If the spell ends before the extremity is reattached to your body, the extremity dies. You regrow the lost extremity when you complete a long rest.

spell.name: Endure Elements
entries: You touch a creature and ward it against extreme weather. A creature protected by this spell suffers no harm from being in a hot or cold environment. It can exist comfortably in conditions between -50 and 140 degrees Fahrenheit without having to make Constitution saving throws. The creature's equipment is likewise protected.
Endure elements doesn't provide protection against cold or fire damage, nor does it protect against other environmental hazards such as smoke, lack of air, and so forth.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a 3rd level spell slot, you can protect up to 5 creatures you touch within 1 minute of casting the spell. When you cast this spell with a 5th level spell slot, you can protect up to 20 creatures you touch within 1 minute of casting the spell.

spell.name: Farsight
entries: When you cast this spell, your visual acuity greatly increases. You can see clearly out to a range of 1,000 feet under normal visual conditions. Additionally, if you have darkvision or truesight, the range of those features is doubled.

components.m: Black paint, applied around your eyes

spell.name: Fleeting Journey
entries: Choose a creature you can see within 60 feet. That creature must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, at the end of that creature's turn, it returns to the place it was at the beginning of its turn.

components.m: A scrap of leather from a worn out boot

spell.name: Ironguts
entries: This spell is a favorite of nobles and those dining with suspect company. A creature you touch becomes immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition for 1 hour. In addition, the creature has resistance to poison damage against ingested poisons.

components.m: A small lump of charcoal

spell.name: Luck
entries: The recipient of this spell is warded against bad luck. The first time they roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw during the spell's duration, they can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

components.m: A four leaf clover

spell.name: Mighty Wallop
entries: You touch a weapon and it's head is incased in a filmy halo out to a distance of several inches. While this spell is active, this weapon deals damage as though it were one size larger (usually, this means adding another base damage die; i.e. a longsword would deal {@damage 2d8} damage, while a greatsword would deal {@damage 3d6} damage).

spell.name: Moonmark
entries: A shapechanger you can see within 30 feet must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it reverts to it original form.

components.m: The seed of a moonseed plant

spell.name: Nosirrag's Abacus
entries: When you cast this spell, you specify an item, object, or creature and you receive a mental count of how many there are within the spell's range. You can be as vague or specific as you like when casting this spell, i.e. specifying "swords" will give you the total number of shortswords, longsword, scimitars, greatswords, et cetera within range, while specifying "{@item Blackrazor}" will let you know if that artifact exists within range. This spell does not extend through dimensional barriers or portals, such as a gate or a wall of force, nor does it extend through a sheet of lead (in fact, lead objects cannot be counted by this spell).
A {@spell Nystul's Magic Aura} spell fools this spell.
This spell has received particular favor from both merchants and generals, who often want to know just what and how many tricks the opposing side has hidden up their sleeve.

components.m: A collection of fine glass beads

spell.name: Patternweave
entries: When you cast this spell, it reinforces the Weave as it flows through a creature you touch. That creature isn't affected by Wild Magic for the duration.

spell.name: Peristalsis
entries: A wave ripples through the solid matter of an area you can see within range, measuring no more than 20 feet by 60 feet. This wave gently but rapidly causes all creatures standing on the surface to move up to 15 feet in a direction you choose. A creature can make a Dexterity saving throw to avoid being moved. All creatures moved by this spell are moved in the same direction. A creature moved by this spell cannot be moved beyond the area of the spell. If a creature cannot move the full distance you prescribe, due to the presence of a wall or another creature moved by this spell for example, it moves as far as it can.
Objects within the area are moved the prescribed distance, including furniture and other loose items. Structural elements are unaffected by this spell.

components.m: A length of preserved intestine

spell.name: Repair Damage
entries: A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to {@dice 1d10} + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell only affects Constructs and creatures with the Constructed Resilience feature, such as warforged.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shelgarn's Persistent Blade
entries: You create a hovering dagger made of force within range. It lasts for the duration of this spell or until you cast this spell again. When you cast the spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the weapon. On a hit, the target takes force damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the weapon up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

components.m: A dagger

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for every 2 slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Shieldbearer
entries: When you cast this spell, an unequipped shield you touch begins to hover near you, and moves to block incoming blows. For the duration of the spell, you gain the shield's benefits without requiring a free hand to use it. If you aren't proficient with shields and cast this spell, then the AC benefit is reduced by 1 but you are otherwise unimpaired.
If the shield requires attunement, you must be attuned to it or the spell fails.

components.m: An unworn glove

spell.name: Skanteus' Solipsism
entries: To cast this spell, you must touch a creature that is asleep. When you do so, that creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, that creature remains asleep and Unconscious regardless of what is going on around them. The creature wakes up if they take damage, then the spell ends. The creature remains asleep for the duration of the spell.
If you maintain {@status concentration} on this spell for the full duration, the target reduces their {@condition exhaustion} level by 2 additional levels.

components.m: A pinch of sand mixed with a drop of alcoholic spirits.

spell.name: Skanteus' Stimulant
entries: When you cast this spell, you ward the target's mind against sleep. You still need to remain sedentary for a period of 8 hours to receive the benefits of a long rest, but you can perform non-labor activities while resting, such as copying spellbooks, brewing potions, or writing strongly worded letters to your colleagues.
The target has advantage against spells and effects that would put them to sleep and, in the case of the sleep spell, the target doubles their total hit point value for the purposes of that spell.
The merits of this spell, and especially habitual use of this spell, are widely debated topics in arcane academia. Use at your own risk.

components.m: A coffee bean or tea leaf.

spell.name: Gedlee's Electric Loop
entries: Gedlee was an ill-fated apprentice seeking to impress his tutors with an original spell. Though he never quite perfected it before an untimely demise, it has persisted through the ages as a spell of last resort for mages that find themselves surrounded by enemies.

When you cast this spell, all creatures in a 15-foot radius centered on yourself are struck by a bolt of lightning that discharges from your outstretched fingertip. Once all creatures have been struck, the lightning then closes the circuit and strikes you. Each creature, including the caster, within the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. Creatures take {@damage 4d6} lightning damage on a failed saving throw, and half as much on a successful save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 2nd. If you cast this as a 4th level spell, the radius expands to 30 feet. If you cast this as an 8th level spell, the radius expands to 60 feet.

spell.name: Filch
entries: You grasp at the air and an item you focus upon appears within your hand. Choose an object you can see within 30 feet that you can hold in one hand. That object is instantaneously transported into your hand.

If the object is one that is held by another creature, either in hand or on their person, then that creature can make an Athletics or Acrobatics check against your spell save DC to retain their hold on the item.
If the object is affixed to a structure or surface the spell fails, regardless of how well it is attached.

components.m: A black silk glove

spell.name: Creeping Cold
entries: You turn the subject's sweat to ice, creating blisters as the ice forms on and inside the skin.

The target makes a Constitution saving throw. The spell deals {@dice 1d8} cumulative points of cold damage per round it is in effect (that is, {@dice 1d8} on the 1st round, {@dice 2d8} on the second, and {@dice 3d8} on the third). If the target succeeded on the saving throw, it takes half damage each round.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 round for each slot level above 1st.

m.text: A small glass or pottery vessel worth at least 25 gp filled with ice, snow, or water

spell.name: Cocoon
entries: When you cast this spell, a willing creature you touch is enveloped in a healing cocoon. If they complete a short rest before exiting the cocoon, any hit dice they spend to restore hit points restore an additional bonus equal to your spellcasting modifier.
While in a cocoon, the target is completely unaware of their surroundings and is Paralyzed until they complete their short rest, or until they take damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at 3rd level, you may target up to 4 creatures with it. When you cast this spell at 5th level, you may target up to 10 creatures with it.

components.m: A bit of eggshell and a dab of honey

spell.name: Chant
entries: By means of a divine chant, the caster brings special favor upon themselves and their allies, and causes harm to their enemies. When this spell is cast, the caster begins chanting. The following effects take place while the chant is ongoing:
You and creatures of your choice within the spell's area gain a +1 bonus on saving throws, skill checks, and attack and damage rolls.
Creatures of your choice within the spell's area suffer a -1 penalty on saving throws, skill checks, and attack and damage rolls.
While you are chanting you cannot speak normally or cast spells with verbal components.  Additionally, your speed is halved while chanting.
The caster can chant for the duration of the spell. Should their chant be interrupted (such as by magical {@spell silence}), the spell ends regardless of your {@status concentration}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the modifier increases to +/-2. When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the modifier increases to +/-3.

spell.name: Cannibalize
entries: When you cast this spell, you channel the animating energy of ghouls, becoming temporarily able to consume dead flesh for sustenance. You consume a piece of a corpse within reach and regain hit points equal to {@dice 3d12} + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell protects you from nonmagical diseases you might normally contract from eating the dead, but does not offer protection of any sort against poisons or other hazards associated with eating dead creatures.
A corpse that has become an undead creature is devoid of the necessary life essence for this spell and cannot be targeted by it.

spell.name: Anxiety Attack
entries: You bombard the target's mind with visions of their own terrible futures and traumatic pasts.

The target makes a Wisdom saving throw. The spell deals {@dice 1d6} cumulative points of psychic damage per round it is in effect (that is, {@dice 1d6} on the 1st round, {@dice 2d6} on the second, and {@dice 3d6} on the third). If the target succeeded on the saving throw, it takes half damage each round.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration increases by 1 round for each slot level above 1st.

m.text: A shattered mirror worth at least 25 gp

spell.name: Acid Rain
entries: A cloud appears 40 feet above a point within range, with a 20-foot radius. The spell fails if you can't see a point in the air where the storm cloud could appear (for example, if you are in a room that can't accommodate the cloud).

The cloud immediately begins raining, dousing all exposed lights in the area. The rain is highly acidic, and all uncovered creatures and objects under the cloud take {@dice 1d6} points of acid damage when they begin their turn under the cloud or the first time they enter the area on their turn, or half that if they succeed on a Constitution saving throw.

If you are outdoors in stormy conditions when you cast this spell, the spell gives you control over the existing storm instead of creating a new one. Under such conditions, the spell's damage dice increases from a {@dice d6} to a {@dice d8}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every 2 slot levels above 2nd.

components.m: An ounce of vinegar

spell.name: Glitterdust
entries: When you cast this spell, a cloud of sparkling particles appears in a 10-foot radius within range. These particles settle on top of objects and creatures, negating any benefits from being {@condition invisible} for the duration of the spell. Additionally, the bright light created by the particles' creation causes creatures within the radius to become {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn. A creature that succeeds on a Dexterity saving throw is not {@condition blinded}.

components.m: 1 ounce of ground mica

spell.name: Heward's Handy Hireling
entries: You conjure a translucent, featureless, Medium humanoid-shaped force ({@creature Heward's Handy Hireling}) that can perform moderately complex tasks at your direction. It has AC 12, 10 hit points, a speed of 30 feet, and Strength and Dexterity scores of 12. If ordered to fight, it does so using its unarmed strikes (+3 to hit, {@damage 1d4 + 1} bludgeoning damage) or with whatever weapons it is provided (it is proficient with simple and martial weapons). If it drops to 0 hit points or leaves the range of the spell, the spell ends and anything it was carrying falls to the ground in its space.

On each of your turns as a bonus action, you can mentally command the force to move up to 30 feet and interact with an object. The force can perform moderately complex tasks that a human servant could do, such as fetching things, cleaning, mending, folding clothes, lighting fires, serving food, and pouring wine. Once you give the command, the force performs the task to the best of its ability until it completes the task, then waits for your next command. If you don't issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its move to avoid danger.
If you command the force to perform a task that would move it more than 60 feet away from you, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the Strength and Dexterity scores of the force increase by 1 for each spell level above 2nd, and the force's hit points increase by 5 for each spell level above 2nd.

components.m: A ball of yarn and a plank of wood

spell.name: Larloch's Drain
entries: The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage. A creature damage by this spell has its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

If you later cast {@spell animate dead} on a creature that you killed with this spell, the resultant undead creature remains under your control permanently. You can have a number of undead servants fashioned in this manner that does not exceed your Proficiency bonus.

components.m: A piece of skin or bone from an undead creature

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Mind Fog
entries: You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of thin blue fog centered on a point within range. The sphere spreads around corners. The fog doesn't obscure vision, but it saps the will and senses of those who enter it. While in this fog, creatures have disadvantage on Insight, Investigation, and Perception checks, and they have disadvantage on Wisdom, Intelligence, and Charisma saving throws. This penalty persists for as long as the creatures are within the area of the fog. The fog lasts for the duration, or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

components.m: A wick of hemp

spell.name: Nosirrag's Commanding Word
entries: When you cast this spell, you touch a magic item and the spell produces a staticky noise for the duration of the spell, during which the spell magically utters every possible command word, in every existing language. At the end of the minute, the spell reveals which command word was the correct one for the item you are touching, and activates the item for you (expending charges as normal). If the item does not have a command word, then the spell informs you thusly.

components.m: A small puzzle box worth at least 25 gp.

spell.name: Porthole
entries: You inscribe a circle on a solid surface no larger than 10 feet in diameter. For the duration of the spell, the area circumscribed by the circle becomes visually and audibly transparent to your side, but retains its normal properties from the other side, allowing you to observe events in an adjacent room or across some other barrier. This spell fails if the surface you cast it on is more than 10 feet thick, or if a thin sheet of lead is a part of the barrier. If the surface takes more than 10 points of damage from either side, then the spell ends.
If you cast this spell in the same location every day for one year, its effects become permanent.

components.m: A perforated sheet of paper

spell.name: Reanimate Dead
entries: You touch an undead creature that has been destroyed within the last minute. That creature returns to undeath with {@dice 1d10} plus your spellcasting bonus hit points. This spell can't return a creature to unlife if it was destroyed by radiant damage.

m.text: A piece of onyx worth at least 50 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Skanteus' Soporific
entries: Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be sent into a magical slumber, falling {@condition unconscious} until the duration, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake.
Undead and creatures immune to being {@condition charmed} aren't affected by this spell.

components.m: A bit of hemp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional humanoid for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Solid Fog
entries: You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of fog centered on a point within range. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. The solid fog is so thick that it is difficult terrain for any creatures moving through it. The vapors prevent ranged weapon attacks of any kind from passing through its area. A creature that falls into solid fog does not include the height of the solid fog when determining how much damage they take from falling. If the solid fog spell is cast on the ground, a creature that falls through it takes no falling damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the radius of the fog increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

components.m: A pinch of dried, powdered peas combined with powdered animal hoof

spell.name: Spellfray
entries: With this spell, you temporarily fray the threads attaching a creature to the Weave. The creature must make a Charisma saving throw, and on a failure, they must roll on the {@table Wild Magic Surge} table each time they cast a spell for the duration of this spell. If that creature has the Wild Magic Surge feature, then they can roll twice on the table and choose the effect they prefer.

components.m: A vial of quicksilver and a piece of velvet

spell.name: Stone Bones
entries: You magically harden the substance of a target undead creature within 30 feet, giving it a +2 bonus to AC.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at 3rd level, you can target one additional creature with this spell. For every slot level above 2nd that you cast this spell, you can target an additional creature.

components.m: A drop of cow's milk

spell.name: Stone Tell
entries: You imbue rocks and non-metallic minerals within 30 feet of you with a limited sentience, giving them the ability to communicate with you and follow simple commands. You can ask the stones questions about events in the spell's area within the past year, gaining information about creatures that have passed, weather, and other circumstances.
The stones have very limited animation; only enough to speak to you.
If an earthen creature is in the area, you can communicate with it as if you shared a common language, but you gain no magical ability to influence it.
If a {@condition petrified} creature is in the area, you can also communicate with it.

spell.name: Summon Myconid
entries: You call forth a the projection of a myconid spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the {@creature myconid spirit} stat block.

When you cast the spell, choose a clade: Truffle, Toadstool, or Madcap. The clade you choose influences the appearance of the myconid spirit and determines certain traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your telepathic commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its move to avoid danger.

components.m: A collection of myconid spores worth at least 200 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For each level above 2nd that you cast this spell, the myconid spirit gains the following benefits:
+10 hp
+1 AC
+1 to attack and damage rolls
Other benefits as described in the stat block

spell.name: Synesthesia
entries: You alter the way your body receives sensory input such that you can either feel light or feel sound. Choose which version of the spell you are using when you cast it:
Feel Light. You are immune to the Blinded condition. You can feel light with your normal visual acuity, including Darkvision if you possess it.
Feel Sound. You are immune to the Deafened condition. You gain Blindsense out to a radius of 10 ft. feet.

These new senses require at least a hand-sized portion of your skin to be uncovered (typically your hands or face). These senses have no special ability to defeat illusions and similar effects. Gaze attacks that require you to see the creature, such as a {@creature medusa} or {@creature basilisk}'s abilities, do not affect you if you are perceiving them solely through the Feel Light version of this spell.

spell.name: Vocalize
entries: You or a creature you touch gain the ability to cast spells without uttering a sound. Until the spell ends, you do not need to speak as part of casting a spell, allowing you to cast spells without drawing undue attention to yourself or while within the effects of a silence spell or similar effect.
If you cast a spell that requires {@status concentration}, you can begin your {@status concentration} on that spell while ending your {@status concentration} on this spell.

components.m: A small bell with no clapper

spell.name: Wall of Paper
entries: You create a wall of paper stretched on fragile, wooden frames on a solid surface within range. You can choose the appearance and design of the paper when you conjure it. You can make the wall up to 30 feet long, 10 feet high, and as thick as cardstock, and it vanishes when the spell ends. You can shape it into a single flat surface, or into segments of 5-foot long panels, which must be contiguous with another panel. You cannot cut through a creatures space with this spell. The wall blocks line of sight and lasts for the duration.
Attacks that pass through the wall treat the target as Heavily Obscured. A creature that makes an attack through the wall destroys the appropriate 5-foot panel of wall.
The wall does not impede movement. Moving through the wall destroys a 5-foot panel of the wall for a Medium or smaller creature, a 10-foot panel for a Large creature, and so on.

components.m: A blank sheet of paper, parchment, or vellum

spell.name: Weld
entries: When you cast this spell, you hold two objects or surfaces together. When you finish casting the spell, any part of the objects that are in contact become stuck fast to each other.

Objects adhered in this way remain welded for 1 day. The welded objects can be broken apart with an Athletics check with a DC equal to your spell save DC, with a casting of {@spell break} or {@spell grease} of a level equal to or higher than this spell, or with the application of {@item universal solvent}.
If you target an object a creature is carrying, that creature can make a Dexterity saving throw to avoid that object becoming welded.
If you cast this spell on the same two objects for a year, the effect becomes permanent.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell with a 4th level spell slot, the duration becomes 1 week. If you cast this spell with a 6th level spell slot, the duration becomes 1 month. If you cast this spell with an 8th level spell slot, the duration becomes permanent.

components.m: A bit of tree sap

spell.name: Baleful Teleport
entries: You teleport portions of the target outside of their own body. The target takes {@damage 5d8} force damage, or half as much on a successful Charisma saving throw.
A target that is under the effects of a {@spell dimensional anchor} spell, or otherwise prevented from teleporting, is immune to this spell.

spell.name: Create Pit
entries: This spell conjures an extradimensional pit on a solid surface, akin to a portable hole. The pit has a 10 foot diameter, and must be placed on a solid surface large enough to accommodate it.

The pit appears on the surface and extends 30 feet beyond the surface into an extradimensional space. A creature that is standing on the surface when the spell is cast must make a Dexterity saving throw or fall into the pit, taking fall damage as appropriate. A creature that succeeds can move to an adjacent space (if available) or cling to the ledge of the spell effect.

The interior of the pit appears to be made of cobbled stone, brickwork, or another textured surface of your choice. The pit is indestructible from the inside. A creature can climb the wall of the pit with a successful Strength (Athletics) check against your spell save DC. Each foot of climbing costs 1 extra foot (see PHB page 182). If a creature that is climbing fails the check by 5 or more, then they fall from their position.
When the spell ends, the pit collapses from the bottom up, safely elevating creatures to the surface.
The strength of the target surface is irrelevant so long as it is solid. For example, you could cast this spell on a thin layer of ice over a lake, but not on a muddy slope.

Disturbing the surface the pit is cast upon from the other side causes the spell to end, such as a burrowing creature that tunnels through the back side of the spell, or a wall that it is cast upon being demolished.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a slot level of 4, the depth of the pit increases to 40 feet. For every slot level above 3rd, increase the depth of the pit by an additional 10 feet.

components.m: A miniature shovel worth 10 gp

spell.name: Greater Mage Armor
entries: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, and a protective magical force surrounds it until the spell ends. The target's base AC becomes 15 + its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the target's base AC becomes 17. When you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the target's base AC becomes 19. When you use a spell slot of 9th level, the target's base AC becomes 21.

m.text: A small piece of cured dragon hide, worth 50 gp.

spell.name: Greater Mage Hand
entries: You create a magical hand of shimmering, translucent force in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The hand lasts for the spell's duration, and it moves at your command, mimicking the movements of your own hand.

The hand is a Tiny object that has AC equal to your spell save DC. If it is damaged, you must make a Constitution saving throw to maintain {@status concentration} on the spell as though you had taken the damage, though you remain unharmed. It has a Strength and Dexterity score equal to your spellcasting ability. The hand doesn't fill its space.
When you cast the spell and as a bonus action on your subsequent turns, you can move the hand up to 30 feet and then cause one of the following effects with it.
Clenched Fist. The hand strikes one creature or object within 5 feet of it. Make a melee spell attack for the hand using your game statistics. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8} force damage.

Deft Hand. The hand can manipulate an object, activate a magic item, or make an attack with a weapon it is wielding. If a magic item requires attunement to activate, and you are attuned to it, the hand can activate it.

Forceful Hand. The hand attempts to shove a creature within 5 feet of it in a direction you choose. Make a check with your spellcasting attribute contested by the Strength (Athletics) check of the target, as per the Shove action. If the target is Large or larger, you have disadvantage on the check.

components.m: A snakeskin glove

spell.name: Iggwilv's Chaotic Companion
entries: When you cast this spell, you target a slaad control gem you possess. When you do so, the slaad it belongs to is summoned at an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet. The slaad must obey whoever possesses the gem, and is immune to being Charmed while so controlled.

The slaad remains for 1 hour, after which it is returned to its home plane of Limbo. After you do so, it cannot be resummoned by this spell for 7 days (though if you summon it via other means or encounter it abroad, you still benefit from possessing its control gem).

m.text: A slaad's control gem

spell.name: Koopander's Chronal Conundrum
entries: Select a willing target within 60 feet. It is placed into a temporal superposition and a duplicate of itself appears within 5 feet of the original. Whenever the creature placed into superposition begins its next turn, it can move the original and the duplicate independently. Whenever it takes an action, bonus action, or reaction, it can take it as though it were in its own space or in the space of the duplicate. If the duplicate is ever more than 30 feet from the original at the end of the original's turn, then it is destroyed and the spell ends.

The duplicate has the AC, resistances, immunities, and other features of the original. If the duplicate takes damage or has hit points restored, then the hit point adjustment is applied to the original. Conditions are not shared between the original and the duplicate.
If a spell or other effect affects an area containing both the original and the duplicate, the effect is only applied once and a saving throw (if applicable) is only made once.

When the spell ends, choose which position the target collapses into. If you choose the original, then the duplicate disappears. If you choose the duplicate, then the duplicate disappears and is replaced by the original.

components.m: A wooden dowel, broken perfectly in half

spell.name: Magic Staff
entries: When you cast this spell, you set a number of pure gemstones into a nonmagical staff and enchant them to hold spell energy.
This staff stores spells cast into it, holding them until used. The staff can store up to 5 levels worth of spells at a time.

You can cast a spell of 1st through 5th level into the staff by holding the staff as the spell is cast. The spell has no effect, other than to be stored in the staff. If the staff can't hold the spell, the spell is expended without effect. The level of the slot used to cast the spell determines how much space it uses.

While holding this staff, you can cast any spell stored in it. The spell uses the slot level, spell save DC, spell attack bonus, and spellcasting ability from when the spell was cast, but is otherwise treated as if you cast the spell. The spell cast from the staff is no longer stored in it, freeing up space.
Only you can cast spells stored within the staff, and only you can store spells in it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a slot level of 4th or higher, the staff you create can hold 2 additional spell levels for each slot level above 3rd. Casting this spell at a higher spot level increases the cost of the material components. At a slot level of 4th, this spell costs 500 gp. At a slot level of 5th, this spell costs 800 gp. At a slot level of 6th, this spell costs 1,250 gp. At a slot level of 7th, this spell costs 2,000 gp. At a slot level of 8th, this spell costs 5,000 gp. At a slot level of 9th, this spell costs 10,000 gp.

m.text: Gemstones worth 250 gp, which are consumed

spell.name: Magnetize
entries: You sheathe the target in a variably polarized magnetic field. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach (a creature can choose to let you hit it). On a hit, choose one of the following options to take effect until the spell ends:

Attraction. Metallic and electrically charged objects are attracted to the target. Attacks with metallic weapons or projectiles have advantage, as do attacks that deal lightning damage. The target has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that deal lightning damage. Metallic objects cling to the target and require a Strength saving throw to pull away.

Repulsion. Metallic and electrically charged objects are repelled from the target. Attacks with metallic weapons or projectiles have disadvantage, as do attacks that deal lightning damage. The target has advantage on saving throws against effects that deal lightning damage. Metallic objects on the target's person are violently repelled unless affixed via secure means. Normally worn armor is unaffected by this, but a metallic melee weapon the target is wielding requires a successful Strength saving throw at the start of each turn to be retained.

components.m: An amber rod and a bit of wool

spell.name: Melf's Unicorn Arrow
entries: When you cast this spell, you transmute an arrow you fire into a shimmering, transparent form of unicorn charging at your foe. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d8} radiant damage and must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is additionally pushed backwards a distance you choose, up to 50 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Mestil's Acid Breath
entries: You release a torrent of caustic fluid, dousing creatures and objects in front of you. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 8d6} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The acid produced by this spell is especially good at dissolving non-magical minerals. Inanimate, nonmagical stone objects take double damage from this spell.

components.m: An ounce of vinegar, which you drink as part of the casting.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Nosirrag's Numerology
entries: When you cast this spell, you divine your success or failure in the immediate future. The spell does not indicate what will happen in the future, only the quality of your efforts.

Roll 5d20s in sequence, recording the number you rolled and the order you rolled them in. The next time you make an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check, do not roll. Instead, use the result of the first {@dice d20} you rolled. Then, on your next attack roll, saving throw, or ability check, use the result of your second {@dice d20} roll, and so on until you use the results of all 5 die rolls.

A mage might be tempted to avoid a bad run of luck by not taking actions they know will fail. If, at the end of this spell's duration, there remain die rolls that have gone unused, then you take {@damage 2d6} psychic damage and gain one level of {@condition exhaustion} for each remaining die roll.

components.m: A pair of weighted dice

spell.name: Nosirrag's Slippery Surface
entries: When you cast this spell, the walls, ceiling, and floor in a 30-foot cube become covered with a silvery, mirror-like substance that is almost totally frictionless. Anything that starts its turn in the area of the spell or enters it on its turn will continue to move in the direction of its last horizontal impetus on a failed Dexterity saving throw (determine direction randomly if a creature fails at the start of its turn). If it collides with a wall or other solid surface, it takes damage as though it had fallen an equivalent distance. If it collides with another creature, they both take this damage. A creature that fails its saving throw or that takes any damage while in the area of this spell is knocked {@condition prone}.

components.m: A piece of glass and a dab of oil

spell.name: Rary's Rebuttal
entries: This spell causes a localized folding of space. The folded space takes the form of an {@condition invisible} disk that protects the caster. When the caster is targeted by a ranged attack, the attack intercepts the disk and is reversed in direction. The attacker finds themselves the target of their own attack, using the original attack roll result. If the attacker rolled a 20 on their attack roll, the attack misses the disk and hits the caster as normal. The caster may direct ranged attacks normally through the disk.
The spell ends early if the caster is hit by a {@spell magic missile} spell.

components.m: A small mirror

spell.name: Rusting Grasp
entries: Any iron or iron alloy item you touch becomes instantaneously rusted, pitted, and worthless, effectively destroyed. If the item is so large that it cannot fit within a 3-foot radius (a large iron door or a wall of iron), a 3-foot-radius volume of the metal is rusted and destroyed. Magic items made of metal are immune to this spell.
You may employ rusting grasp in combat with a successful melee spell attack, causing one of the following effects:
A creature wearing metal armor reduces their AC by your proficiency bonus, as their armor rusts away.
A single metal weapon or object held in hand by a creature is destroyed.
A creature substantially made of metal, such as an iron golem, takes {@damage 8d8} necrotic damage.

spell.name: Scatterspray
entries: Choose a collection of small objects you hold in your hand. These objects shatter and fly away from you at high speed, filling a 30-foot cone with the shrapnel. Creatures in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 5d8} piercing damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Shadow Door
entries: When you cast this spell, you create the illusion of a {@spell dimension door} spell and step through. Instead of being transported elsewhere, you are instead rendered {@condition invisible} for 1 minute. The spell ends if you attack or cast a spell. This spell appears to be a {@spell dimension door} to all observers (even appearing as conjuration magic when observed under {@spell detect magic}), however a creature that can detect {@condition invisible} creatures will still detect your presence.

spell.name: Skanteus' Mind Snare
entries: With this spell, you weave an arcane trap inside your mind for any invaders. This spell has two versions; you either cast it while you are awake, or right before you go to sleep:

Awake. You ward your mind against mental intrusions. Any creature that attempts to sense your emotions or read your thoughts, or one that would bestow the {@condition charmed} condition upon you, takes {@damage 5d6} psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. On a successful Wisdom saving throw, the creature takes half damage and is not {@condition stunned}.  A creature which fails its saving throw may attempt again at the end of it's turn.

Asleep. This spell lurks in your dreams, staying on the edges of your perception as a comforting creature or object. If your dreams are invaded or tampered with while you sleep, such as by the {@spell dream} spell or a {@creature night hag}'s nightmare haunting, the solipsistic interloper springs the trap. They take {@damage 5d6} psychic damage or half as much on a successful Wisdom saving throw. If they psychically invaded your dreams, then they are trapped there. You immediately become aware that you are dreaming, and can choose to wake up or hold the invader in place, preventing them from waking up while you are asleep.

A {@creature night hag} that triggers a this spell using their nightmare haunting ability is forced to the Material Plane and {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute if they failed their saving throw. They can attempt their saving throw again at the end of each turn.
At the DM's discretion, other creatures might also be specially affected by this spell.
After the spell has warded against one such mental intrusion, the spell ends.

components.m: A tiara set with moonstones and made with threads of silver wire worth at least 25 gp

spell.name: Stutterstep
entries: When you cast this spell, you manipulate time around a creature to get it caught in a temporal loop.

A creature you can see within 30 feet makes a Charisma saving throw. If they fail, then they must repeat the same set of actions they took the previous turn. For example, a creature that moved 30 feet northwest will move another 30 feet northwest; a creature that took the Attack action against a {@creature goblin} adjacent to them will take the Attack action against a creature occupying the same space; a creature that cast {@spell magic missile} on an enemy will cast {@spell magic missile} again against the same target. Due to the temporal loop created by this spell, resources that a creature expends are not expended again (therefore the example involving {@spell magic missile} would only expend 1 spell slot).
A creature with Legendary Actions is immune to the effects of this spell.

components.m: A pendulum

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Transfer Enchantment
entries: This spell transfers all magical properties from one item to another, destroying the first item while making the second item magical. The two items must be similar in function; such as a longsword's enchantments being transferred to a shortsword.
The item to receive the enchantment must be nonmagical, but capable of holding the enchantment to be transferred.

The spellcaster must make a successful Intelligence (Arcana) check to transfer the magical properties, as shown below. If the check fails, then the caster may try again after they have taken a long rest.
Commonâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦. DC 10
Uncommonâ€¦â€¦â€¦... DC 13
Rareâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦.. DC 17
Very Rareâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦ DC 20
Legendaryâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦. DC 25
Artifactsâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦. N/A
A sentient magic item can make a Charisma saving throw to resist the effect.

m.text: A cauldron made of cold iron costing no less than 1,000 gp, which is not consumed, and 250 gp worth of ruby dust, which is consumed.

spell.name: Transposition
entries: Choose two creatures who are within 60 feet of each other and yourself (you can be one of these creatures). Those two creatures are simultaneously teleported, swapping positions with each other. An unwilling creature may make a Charisma saving throw to resist this teleportation and if either target successfully resists the spell, the spell fails.
If there is a size difference between the creatures, there must be room for both creatures to arrive, or else the spell fails.

spell.name: Tremorsense
entries: When you cast this spell, you gain tremorsense out to a radius of 30 feet.

A creature with tremorsense can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within a specific radius, provided that the creature and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance. Tremorsense can't be used to detect flying or incorporeal creatures.
A creature with tremorsense does not suffer any penalties for attacking or being attacked by an {@condition invisible} creature it detects with its tremorsense.

components.m: The whiskers of a badgermole

spell.name: Waterball
entries: A waterball is a spherical burst of water that looks like a blue {@spell fireball}. A blue, pea-sized bead streaks from your pointing digit and blossoms into a waterball at a point you choose within range. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point takes {@damage 5d6} bludgeoning damage and is knocked Prone. On a successful Constitution saving throw, a creature takes half damage.
A creature reduced to 0 hit points by a waterball is knocked {@condition unconscious} but is not dying, making this a preferred spell for peaceful mages.
All open flames in the area are doused.

A fire elemental, or other creature with the water susceptibility trait, takes {@damage 5d6} cold damage from this spell (in addition to the bludgeoning damage), which also scales with levels as shown below.

components.m: A full waterskin, which you burst in the casting

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Wind Tunnel
entries: When you cast this spell, choose a creature within 120 feet. You manipulate the air between you and the target. For the duration of the spell, you have advantage on ranged weapon attacks against them and they have disadvantage on ranged weapon attack rolls against you.

spell.name: Anyspell
entries: This spell allows you to channel magical energies to cast a spell you don't know or have prepared. When you cast this spell, you examine the magical writings used for the material component of this spell and choose a spell that is written there of up to 2nd level. That spell is cast as a 2nd level spell. Using this spell, you can cast spells from any class spell list as long as you have access to a magical writing of the spell. If you use a scroll as the material component for this spell, it is not consumed when you cast this spell. Any costs of the spell you are replicating must also be paid when you cast this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at 5th level or higher, you increase the level of the spell you can replicate and the level it is cast at by 1 for each slot level above 4th.

components.m: A scroll or spellbook containing the spell to be cast

spell.name: Claws of the Umber Hulk
entries: You touch a willing target and their hands undergo a brief, but painful, transmutation into a pair of wide, steel-hard, chitinous claws.

For the duration of this spell, the target cannot cast spells with somatic components or wield weapons. They can make a melee weapon attack with their claws, which they are proficient with. On a hit, they inflict {@damage 1d8} slashing damage. Attacks with these claws count as magic weapons.

Furthermore, the target gains a burrowing speed of 20 feet. If the target burrows through solid rock (or a similar material), they leave a 5-foot wide tunnel in their wake. If a creature burrows through a softer material, the tunnel collapses behind them. If the spell ends while they creature is underground, they are trapped there unless they have other means of escaping. While they are trapped, they are {@condition restrained} and they begin suffocating.

components.m: A piece of chitinous exoskeleton

spell.name: Defensive Harmony
entries: A shimmering field appears and surrounds allies within 15 feet of you. You and your allies within range gain a +2 bonus to AC for the duration.

components.m: A small parchment with a bit of holy text written on it

spell.name: Dimensional Anchor
entries: A green ray springs from your outstretched hand. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature you can see within 120 feet. If you hit, that creature is surrounded by bands of emerald force that block extradimensional travel, including teleportation or travel to a different plane of existence. An affected creature is not prevented from passing through an interdimensional portal.

components.m: a piece of paper, folded and transfixed by a needle

spell.name: Drown
entries: Choose a creature within 60 feet. That creature must make a Constitution saving throw or its lungs fill with water. If the creature requires air to breathe, it begins to suffocate. A suffocating creature can survive for a number of rounds equal to 1 + its Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 round). At the start of its next turn after those rounds are over, it becomes drops to 0 hit points and is dying, and it can't regain hit points until it can breathe again.

spell.name: Fate's Metronome
entries: As an action, you steal some potential from a creature's future to buttress their current situation. A willing creature you can see within 60 feet heals {@dice 7d6} hit points. After 1 minute, or if the target is subjected to {@spell dispel magic} or a similar effect, the target takes {@damage 10d6} damage which can not be reduced or ignored.

components.m: A pendulum, swung from the hand

spell.name: Fingers of the Mountain
entries: When you cast this spell, creatures of your choice within a 30 foot radius are struck by lightning bolts called down from the heavens (or the ceiling, if cast indoors). Each creature targeted must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

components.m: A rock from the summit of a mountain.

spell.name: Nosirrag's Baneful Backfire
entries: When you cast this spell, you lay a magical trap for anyone that would unravel your dweomers. The next spell you cast, following this one, is wrapped in a hidden layer of baneful abjuration magic that damages a creature other than yourself that casts {@spell dispel magic} or otherwise ends that spell early. A creature that does prematurely end the spell encased by {@spell Nosirrag's Baneful Backfire} must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they take {@damage 5d8} psychic damage and are {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, they take half damage and are not {@condition stunned}.

{@spell Nosirrag's Baneful Backfire} is difficult to detect with detect magic or similar spells, requiring the caster to succeed on an Arcana check against your spell save DC to notice the presence of an abjuration effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

components.m: A silver padlock worth 50 gp

spell.name: Quintessence
entries: You collapse a bit of time from the continuum, forming a 1-ounce dollop of thick, gooey material called quintessence. This substance shimmers like a silver mirror when viewed from some angles but is transparent from other viewpoints. You can smooth a dollop of quintessence around any extremely small object.

Objects sealed within quintessence are protected from the effects of time; in practical terms, they enter a state of stasis. Living flesh with only partial contact with quintessence is also partially pulled out of the time stream. This disruption deals 1 necrotic damage per round beginning 1 minute after partial contact occurs.

Quintessence can be manually scraped away from a protected object, freeing it to rejoin the time stream. When you do this, there is a 75% chance that the quintessence evaporates back into the continuum. Otherwise, it coalesces again into a 1-inch-diameter bead, available for later use.

Large quantities of quintessence could theoretically be gathered to preserve large items or structures (or even a complete living creature; if completely immersed, a living creature would not take the damage associated with partial contact), however mages are typically loathe to do so because accumulations of quintessence weighing 1 pound or more hinder magical energy within a 5-foot radius of the accumulation. Within this range, a spellcaster attempting to cast a spell must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw to be able to cast it. Furthermore, spells with a casting time of reaction or bonus action require an action to cast within this range.

spell.name: Rary's Mnemonic Enhancer
entries: When you cast this spell, choose one of two effects:
Prepare. You regain up to three levels of spell slots you have already cast (such as three 1st-level spells, a 2nd- and a 1st-level spell, or a 3rd-level spell).
Correct. You can change a number of spells you have prepared up to your spellcasting ability modifier with other spells you have in your spell book.

m.text: A piece of string, a mix of squid ink and black dragon blood, and an ivory plaque of at least 50 gp in value

spell.name: Riptide
entries: Seized by magical force, a body of liquid within range (up to a 30-foot sphere) becomes violently upset, with adjacent currents moving in opposite directions at such speeds they can crush hulls and rend flesh. All creatures caught within the area take {@dice 8d8} points of force damage, or half as much on a successful Constitution saving throw. A creature who is only partially submerged (such as standing in a stream) has advantage on their saving throw.

A creature within the area of the spell, but who is not in contact with a body of liquid, is not affected by this spell unless they themselves are a liquid creature, such as a water elemental or ooze. For example, a creature in a rowboat on the surface of a lake would not be damaged by the ripping currents beneath them, though their boat may not fare so well!
If you target a liquid creature with this spell, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage, and the spell deals maximum damage to it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Sequencer
entries: This spell holds the magical energy of other spells until needed by the caster. As part of the casting for this spell, choose spells whose slot levels total to 3 or less, and with casting times of 1 action or less. You cast those spells as part of casting sequencer â€” expending spell slots for all of themâ€” but those spells don't come into effect. Instead, they remains stored until you release them.

Releasing the spells stored with sequencer is a reaction. When you take this reaction, all of the stored spells are cast at once and take effect in the order you choose. If {@spell sequencer} ends and you have not cast the spells you are holding, then those spells are lost. If a stored spell requires {@status concentration}, then you must still concentrate on it.
You can only have one {@spell sequencer} spell in effect at a time.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a 6th-level spell slot, you can store spells totaling to 4 levels. When you cast this spell with a 8th-level spell slot, you can store spells totaling to 5 levels.

components.m: An abacus

spell.name: Transmute Mud to Stone
entries: This spell transmutes a 10-foot cube of normal mud or quicksand into a soft stone, such as limestone or sandstone.

Creatures within the area of mud are entitled to a Dexterity saving throw to escape before the area hardens. On a failure, they are {@condition restrained}. Fortunately for them, the manner in which this spell creates stone leaves many air bubbles and cavities in the stone, and they can break out (or be broken out) by destroying the section trapping them. A 5-foot area of stone produced by this spell has an AC of 16 and 20 hit points, is resistant to slashing damage, and is immune to poison and psychic damage.
If you maintain your {@status concentration} on this spell for the entire possible duration, the mud becomes stone permanently.

components.m: Sand, lime, and water

spell.name: Transmute Stone to Mud
entries: This spell turns a 10-foot cube of rock and stone into an equal volume of mud. If cast upon a boulder, wall, or similar large rock, it collapses into a pool of mud unless otherwise supported. Magical stone is not affected by this spell.

A large or smaller creature standing on a stone surface that is transmuted into mud might sink into it. A creature that enters the mud on their turn or begins their turn there must make a Strength saving throw or sink into it, becoming Restrained until they succeed on a Strength saving throw. A small or smaller creature that sinks into the mud begins suffocating. Huge and larger creatures are unaffected by mud of this depth.
Creatures standing under a stone ceiling that is transmuted into mud take {@damage 8d6} bludgeoning damage from the falling mud, or half that on a successful Dexterity saving throw.

If you cast this spell on a creature made primarily of stone, such as a {@spell gargoyle}, the creature is affected as though by a {@spell slow} spell unless they succeed on a Constitution saving throw.

If you maintain your {@status concentration} on this spell for the entire possible duration, the stone becomes mud permanently. Evaporation turns the mud into normal dirt over a period of days, subject to exposure to sun, wind, and other environmental conditions.
If this spell ends early, either because you cease {@status concentration||concentrating} or because it is dispelled, the mud is restored to its original stone state, but not necessarily its form.

components.m: Clay and water

spell.name: Wall of Gears
entries: A wall of turning gears of various sizes springs into existence at a point you choose within range. The can be up to 5 feet thick, 20 feet high, and 60 feet long. When the wall appears, or when a creature ends its turn in the area or enters its area on its turn, each creature in its area takes {@damage 5d8} bludgeoning damage and is moved to a location of your choice that is within 5 feet of the spell's area and within 30 feet of their original location. A creature that succeeds on a Dexterity saving throw takes half damage and is not moved.

components.m: A small cog and a spring

spell.name: Dolorous Decay
entries: You choose a creature within range who is injured and amplify their injuries, causing it to continue bleeding, go gangrenous, and wither and blacken with decay. On each turn this spell is active, your target makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 10 points of necrotic damage on a failed save and having their speed reduced by half until the end of their next turn.

spell.name: Duodimensions
entries: Your form collapses in on itself, leaving you with only two dimensions: height and width, with no depth. As a duo-dimensional creature, you can pass through the thinnest of spaces as long as the space has the proper height. For example, you can squeeze through the space between a door and its frame without any trouble.

While two-dimensional, you perform actions normally. As a bonus action, you can turn sideways to disappear, detectable only with a {@spell true seeing} spell or similar methods of true sight ({@spell see invisibility} does not work against this spell). While {@condition invisible} in this way, you can not be affected by any form of attack nor can you make attacks, interact with objects, or cast spells. However, when you are visible, you are vulnerable to all damage.

You do not truly lose a dimension when you cast this spell. Instead, the magic diverts one of your dimensions into the astral plane. Due to this, you are vulnerable to damage from the astral plane, such as described in the {@spell astral projection} spell.

m.text: a piece of the finest ivory in the likeness of the caster, studded with gems and lined with gold worth at least 500 gp, and a piece of regular parchment

spell.name: Nosirrag's Gelatinous Gaoler
entries: You summon a gelatinous cube to capture your foes like flies in amber. When you cast this spell, choose if you summon a {@creature Gelatinous Cube} or an {@creature Incacerating Cube.}

Choose a target you can see within range. Your target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the cube is summoned in your target's space and engulfs the target, as per its engulf ability. On a successful save, the cube instead appears in the nearest unoccupied space.
A cube summoned by this spell disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The summoned cube is friendly to you and your companions. The creature acts on your initiative. They obey any telepathic commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to it, it pursues engulfing and attacking the spell's original target. If the original target is dead, then the cube defends itself but takes no actions.
If you maintain your {@status concentration} on this spell for its whole duration, the cube becomes permanent, though it is no longer friendly towards you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 7th level spell slot, you may choose an additional target and summon a second cube. When you cast the spell using a 9th level spell slot, you may choose three targets and summon three cubes.

components.m: Cornstarch and water

spell.name: Nymph's Beauty
entries: With this spell, you cast a glamour over yourself that grants you the supernatural beauty of a nymph. All humanoids within 30 feet who can see you must make a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. They may attempt a new saving throw at the end of their turn.

A creature that rolls a 1 on their Wisdom saving throw becomes obsessed with you, even after the spell wears off. Such a creature has disadvantage on any effects you create that would render them Charmed.

components.m: A peacock feather

spell.name: Extract Water Elemental
entries: You point your finger at a creature, causing it to dehydrate horribly as the moisture in its body is forcibly extracted through its eyes, nostrils, mouths, and pores. This deals {@damage 8d8} necrotic damage, or half that on a successful Constitution saving throw. After the target takes damage, the water pulled from their body is animated into a creature within 5 feet of the target, which uses the {@creature Elemental Spirit} stat block (water variant only).
This spell has no effect on undead or constructs. If you target a plant creature or a magical plant, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage, and the spell deals maximum damage to it.

components.m: A pinch of salt

spell.name: Greater Anyspell
entries: This spell allows you to channel magical energies to cast a spell you don't know or have prepared. When you cast this spell, you choose a spell of 3rd level or lower from any spell list with a casting time of 1 action or less. That spell is cast as a 3rd level spell. Any costs of the spell you are replicating must also be paid when you cast this spell, in addition to the material component of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at 7th level or higher, you increase the level of the spell you can replicate and the level it is cast at by 1 for each slot level above 6th.

m.text: A diamond worth at least 250 gp, which the spell consumes.

spell.name: Stone to Flesh
entries: This spell ends the {@condition petrified} condition on a target.

Additionally, the spell also can convert a mass of stone into a fleshy substance. Such flesh is inert and lacking a vital life force unless a life force or magical energy is available. For example, this spell could turn something like a {@creature stone golem} into something like a {@creature flesh golem}, but an ordinary statue would become a corpse. A creature made mostly of stone, or whose defensive properties come from stone, that is subjected to this spell has their AC reduced by 5, and might have other effects, at the GM's discretion.
You can affect a nonmagical object that fits within a cylinder from 5 feet in diameter and up to 10 feet long or a cylinder of up to those dimensions in a larger mass of stone.
An unwilling target of this spell can resist it on a successful Constitution saving throw.
If you maintain your {@status concentration} on this spell for the entire possible duration, the effect becomes permanent.

components.m: A pinch of earth and a drop of blood

spell.name: Antimagic Ray
entries: An {@condition invisible} ray projects from your fingertip. Make a ranged spell attack against your target. If struck, the target is treated as though they were inside an {@spell antimagic field}.

If this spell is used against an object, that object's magical powers are suppressedâ€”including any spells previously cast and currently in effect on the item, as well as any spells or magical effects targeted on the object during the antimagic ray's duration.

The spell doesn't affect any objects other than the target itself, even if those objects are worn, carried by, or in contact with the target. They are still capable of casting spells from scrolls, wands, and staves, however they are not able to receive the benefits (or deleterious effects) of any spells or magic items themselves, including potions.
For instance, if a creature is the target, its equipment remains unaffected.
A creature struck by this spell may attempt a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns to shake off the effect.

m.text: Ruby dust worth 100 gp

spell.name: Nezram's Ruby Ray of Reversal
entries: A thin, bright red line springs from your fingertip to reverse a hazard you face. This spell can "correct" the following types of situations:
A trap you are aware of can be targeted by the ray to spring it. This can adversely effect creatures standing within the trap's area.

Restraints, such as mundane ropes or manacles, magical effects such as {@spell entangle}, {@spell hold person}, or {@spell snare}, or more esoteric means, are undone. For the purposes of this spell, a "restraint" is an effect that prevents movement altogether, or inflicts the {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition restrained} condition. Spells such as {@spell hypnotic pattern}, {@spell maze}, or {@spell slow} are unaffected.
A creature that has been polymorphed or {@condition petrified} is returned to its natural state. This does not affect a shapechanger's form, such as with a werewolf or doppelganger.
A 5-foot diameter hole is opened in a {@spell blade barrier}, {@spell wall of fire}, or {@spell wall of force} spell or similar effects. This does not end the spell.
Webs, slime, grease, or other environmental effects (magical or mundane) that would hamper a creature's movement are destroyed in a 20-foot radius.
An illusion struck by this spell is dispelled, and {@condition invisible} creatures are rendered visible.
This spell has no effect on magical effects created by a spell of 7th level or higher.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell as an 8th level spell, it can affect magical effects created by spells of 7th level and lower. When you cast this spell as a 9th level spell, it can affect magical effects created by spells of 8th level and lower.

m.text: A ruby worth 500 gp

spell.name: Symbol (extra symbols)
entries: When you cast this spell, you inscribe a harmful glyph either on a surface (such as a section of floor, a wall, or a table) or within an object that can be closed to conceal the glyph (such as a book, a scroll, or a treasure chest). If you choose a surface, the glyph can cover an area of the surface no larger than 10 feet in diameter. If you choose an object, that object must remain in its place; if the object is moved more than 10 feet from where you cast this spell, the glyph is broken, and the spell ends without being triggered.
The glyph is nearly {@condition invisible}, requiring an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC to find it.

You decide what triggers the glyph when you cast the spell. For glyphs inscribed on a surface, the most typical triggers include touching or stepping on the glyph, removing another object covering it, approaching within a certain distance of it, or manipulating the object that holds it. For glyphs inscribed within an object, the most common triggers are opening the object, approaching within a certain distance of it, or seeing or reading the glyph.

You can further refine the trigger so the spell is activated only under certain circumstances or according to a creature's physical characteristics (such as height or weight), or physical kind (for example, the ward could be set to affect hags or shapechangers). You can also specify creatures that don't trigger the glyph, such as those who say a certain password.

When you inscribe the glyph, choose one of the options below for its effect. Once triggered, the glyph glows, filling a 60-foot-radius sphere with dim light for 10 minutes, after which time the spell ends. Each creature in the sphere when the glyph activates is targeted by its effect, as is a creature that enters the sphere for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
Death.
Each target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 10d10} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save.
Discord.
